results.title: Expanding classroom: Elizabethan village
results.creator_credit: Eileen Molony, British Broadcasting Corporation, Worcestershire Education Authority and G Inger
results.brief_description: The pupils of the senior class at Ashton-under-Hill Primary School reconstruct life in Elizabethan times - constructing wattle-and-daub walls, weaving rush mats, cooking Elizabethan dishes, playing Tudor music, writing with quill pens, writing and giving their own interpretation of witches’ spells, and collecting herbs.

results.title: Expand my boundaries
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Denise VanWyk and ACMI
results.brief_description: When she was given the opportunity to study in Melbourne, Denise VanWyk and her family seized it with both hands. She marvels at her new home, its diversity, acceptance and relaxed atmosphere.

results.title: Exotic Bali
results.brief_description: An introductory travelogue focusing on the potential tourist attractions that Bali has to offer. Areas included are: Farmlife and market life, cultural ceremonies and way of life, cock fighting, a Balanese funeral procession, cultural ceremonies.

results.title: Exits
results.creator_credit: Carolyn Howard, Pat Laughren and Paul Davies
results.brief_description: A personal reaction to the ironies implicit in Remembrance Day, 11 November, 1975. “Exits” is an experimental feature film, one of the first Australian features to merge documentary and enacted elements. The film looks at the effects of the Whitlam sacking on a handful of people wandering the streets, dumps, pubs and public transport of Melbourne. It uses a mixture of radio voice-overs, poems, telexes, headlines and press conferences to set a documentary background against which the growing anger and frustration (or indifference) of the characters can be measured. Rated: G

results.title: Exit No Exit
results.creator_credit: Deanne Edwards and Arts Council of Great Britain
results.brief_description: This is a love story - both real and imaginary - told in dance and music, and filmed on location in the London Underground. The real world of commuters, buskers and tube trains is the setting for a journey of the imagination. In the underworld beneath the underground a story without words unfolds. Boy meets the girl of his dreams but their love is shattered.

results.title: Exit
results.creator_credit: Dennis Meltzer, Aranda Films and Bruce McNaughton
results.brief_description: A drama about a group of people stranded at an old wartime guesthouse during a flood. One guest announces that he has the power to “decreate” people and is asked to demonstrate. From an original story by Harry Farjeon. Cast includes: Mark Albiston, Stewart Faichney, Tom Lake, Dina Mann, Brian Moll, John Russell and Sandra Wright.

results.title: Exiles of love
results.creator_credit: 4BC, Greater London Arts and Toby Kalitowski
results.brief_description: Inspired by the life and works of Jean Genet, this short video includes interviews with four contemporary gay film-makers/writers - Derek Jarman, Neil Bartlett, Constantine Giannaris and Robert Chevara - to investigate the pleasure, the danger, the joy and fear involved in homosexual love and sex. Interspersed with the interviews are scenes set in a prison: gay romanticism and eroticism are linked to a social history of sexual repression and oppression.

results.title: Exile in Sarajevo
results.creator_credit: Tom Zubrycki, Exile Productions, Tahir Cambis and Alma Sahbaz
results.brief_description: A passionate and personal account of the siege of Sarajevo, from the viewpoint of Bosnian-Australian Tahir Cambis and Sarajevan, Alma Sahbaz. The directors encapsulate wider tragedies within two unfolding narratives. Nirvan, a talented young dancer, dies after a shelling attack. Her family, unable to come to terms with their loss, is forced to leave Sarajevo as refugees bound for America. Eight year old Amira’s illustrated diary is poignant testimony of the murder of family and friends. Both stories are set within the context of NATO bombing missions, UN Press Conferences and the liberation and reunification of parts of the city under Bosnian-Serb control. Cambis and Sahbaz the filmmakers become Cambis and Sahbaz the subjects. The grief of people around Cambis resonates with his own mother’s flight from Sarajevo in the 1950’s, forcing him to examine his own cultural inheritance. Anguished, enraged, even funny at times, ‘Exile in Sarajevo’ is an elegy for a city where Serbs, Bosnians and Croats still live in harmony, ignoring the myth of ethnic hatred. Edited by Bill Murphy, photographed by Roman Baska, Tahir Cambis and Alma Sahbaz.

results.title: Exile
results.creator_credit: Gilbert Lauzun, Joe O'Brien and United Nations Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “International Zone”.
Tells the story of Wilson Conco, a black South African physician who left South Africa because of the apartheid system and now lives with his family in London.
